article.title: Extending the formulaeditor
article.subtitle: Adding functions like sin using a template (model)

section.title: Introduction
section.para: A lot of functions are entered and displayed in a similar way. They consist of a function name (some word) followed by an opening bracket (, a single argument, and a closing bracket ).

If these functions are added with javascript code, then the code would be very similar for all of them. This can lead to errors if people copy code and do not take the time to properly edit it. Furthermore if some changes need to be made, then these changes will have to be made to all the different files.

These problems do not appear if a single template or model is used to generate the code for several of these functions by only having to enter a few entries per function. This article describes how this has been made possible and how it can be used and extended.
